1 Corinthians__09.1: Am not I free? Am not I an apostle? Have not I seen Christ Jesus our Lord? Are not you my work in the Lord?
1 Corinthians__09.2: And if unto others I be not an apostle, but yet to you I am. For you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.
1 Corinthians__09.3: My defence with them that do examine me is this.
1 Corinthians__09.4: Have not we power to eat and to drink?
1 Corinthians__09.5:
Have we not power to carry about<u>
                a woman, a sister
               </u>, as well as the rest of the apostles, and the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?
1 Corinthians__09.6: Or I only and Barnabas, have not we power to do this?
1 Corinthians__09.7: Who serveth as a soldier at any time, at his own charges? Who planteth a vineyard, and eateth not of the fruit thereof? Who feedeth the flock, and eateth not of the milk of the flock?
1 Corinthians__09.8: Speak I these things according to man? Or doth not the law also say these things?
1 Corinthians__09.9: For it is written in the law of Moses: Thou shalt not muzzle the mouth of the ox that treadeth out the corn. Doth God take care for oxen?
1 Corinthians__09.10: Or doth he say this indeed for our sakes? For these things are written for our sakes: that he that plougheth, should plough in hope; and he that thrasheth, in hope to receive fruit.
1 Corinthians__09.11: If we have sown unto you spiritual things, is it a great matter if we reap your carnal things?
1 Corinthians__09.12: If others be partakers of this power over you, why not we rather? Nevertheless, we have not used this power: but we bear all things, lest we should give any hindrance to the gospel of Christ.
1 Corinthians__09.13: Know you not, that they who work in the holy place, eat the things that are of the holy place; and they that serve the altar, partake with the altar?
1 Corinthians__09.14: So also the Lord ordained that they who preach the gospel, should live by the gospel.
1 Corinthians__09.15: But I have used none of these things. Neither have I written these things, that they should be so done unto me: for it is good for me to die, rather than that any man should make my glory void.
1 Corinthians__09.16:
For if I preach the gospel,<u>
                it is no glory
               </u>to me, for a necessity lieth upon me: for woe is unto me if I preach not the gospel.
1 Corinthians__09.17: For if I do this thing willingly, I have a reward: but if against my will, a dispensation is committed to me:
1 Corinthians__09.18: What is my reward then? That preaching the gospel, I may deliver the gospel without charge, that I abuse not my power in the gospel.
1 Corinthians__09.19: For whereas I was free as to all, I made myself the servant of all, that I might gain the more.
1 Corinthians__09.20: And I became to the Jews, a Jew, that I might gain the Jews:
1 Corinthians__09.21: To them that are under the law, as if I were under the law, (whereas myself was not under the law,) that I might gain them that were under the law. To them that were without the law, as if I were without the law, (whereas I was not without the law of God, but was in the law of Christ,) that I might gain them that were without the law.
1 Corinthians__09.22: To the weak I became weak, that I might gain the weak. I became all things to all men, that I might save all.
1 Corinthians__09.23: And I do all things for the gospel's sake: that I may be made partaker thereof.
1 Corinthians__09.24: Know you not that they that run in the race, all run indeed, but one receiveth the prize? So run that you may obtain.
1 Corinthians__09.25: And every one that striveth for the mastery, refraineth himself from all things: and they indeed that they may receive a corruptible crown; but we an incorruptible one.
1 Corinthians__09.26: I therefore so run, not as at an uncertainty: I so fight, not as one beating the air:
1 Corinthians__09.27:
But<u>
                I chastise
               </u>my body, and bring it into subjection: lest perhaps, when I have preached to others, I myself should become a castaway.
